item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Thereâ€™s man all over for you, blaming on his boots the faults of his feet." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It is our choices, Harry, that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "It does not do to dwell on dreams and forget to live." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "Just because you have the emotional range of a teaspoon doesn't mean we all have." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "I solemnly swear that I am up to no good." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Here it is,' Nigel said. Mrs D, Mrs I, Mrs FFI, Mrs C, Mrs U, Mrs LTY. That spells difficulty.' How perfectly ridiculous!' snorted Miss Trunchbull. 'Why are all these women married?" -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "Matilda said, "Never do anything by halves if you want to get away with it. Be outrageous. Go the whole hog. Make sure everything you do is so completely crazy it's unbelievable..." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I'm wondering what to read next." Matilda said. "I've finished all the children's books." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "Maybe you can afford to wait. Maybe for you there's a tomorrow. Maybe for you there's one thousand tomorrows, or three thousand, or ten, so much time you can bathe in it, roll around it, let it slide like coins through you fingers. So much time you can waste it. But for some of us there's only today. And the truth is, you never really know." -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "It amazes me how easy it is for things to change, how easy it is to start off down the same road you always take and wind up somewhere new. Just one false step, one pause, one detour, and you end up with new friends or a bad reputation or a boyfriend or a breakup. It's never occurred to me before; I've never been able to see it. And it makes me feel, weirdly, like maybe all of these different possibilities exist at the same time, like each moment we live has a thousand other moments layered underneath it that look different." -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Is it possible for home to be a person and not a place?" -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "This is home. The two of us." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Will you please tell me you love me? Iâ€™m dying here." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Madame Guillotine gets mad at me. Not because I told them to shove it, but because I didnâ€™t say it in French. What is wrong with this school?" -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "I mean, really. Who sends their kid to boarding school? It's so Hogwarts. Only mine doesn't have cute boy wizards or magic candy or flying lessons." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "The important people in our lives leave imprints. They may stay or go in the physical realm, but they are always there in your heart, because they helped form your heart. There's no getting over that." -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by David Levithan
item.description: "Luckily, I always travel with a book, just in case I have to wait on line for Santa, or some such inconvenience." -- David Levithan

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "So far I've seen the life studies packet used as (1) an umbrella, (2) a makeshift towel, (3) a pillow, and now this. I have never actually seen anyone study with it, which either means that everyone who graduates from Thomas Jefferson will be totally unprepared for life or that certain things can't be learned in bullet-point format." -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Rachel Cohn
item.description: "I've always resented Hermione, because I wanted to be her so badly and she never seemed to appreciate as much as I thought she should that she got be her. She got to live at Hogwarts and be friends with Harry and kiss Ron, which was supposed to happen to me." -- Rachel Cohn

item.title: Liz (Consumed by Books) add a quote by Maggie Stiefvater
item.description: "So, Grace, how's school?" I asked myself. Dad nodded, eyes on the baby koala now struggling in the guest's arms. "Oh, it's fine," I continued, and Dad made a mumbling noise of agreement. I added, "Nothing special, aside from the load of pandas they brought in, and the teachers abandoning us to cannibalistic savages-" I paused to see if I'd caught his attention yet, then pressed on. "The whole building caught fire, then I failed drama, and then sex, sex, sex." Dad's eyes abruptly focused, and he turned to me and frowned. "What did you say they were teaching you in school?" -- Maggie Stiefvater
